meanings.definition: The state or quality of being fixed or immovable.
meanings.sent1: The fixednesses of the heavy boulder made it impossible to move.
meanings.sent2: The fixednesses of the old tree roots held the soil in place.
meanings.sent3: The fixednesses of the stubborn door made it a challenge to open.
meanings.sent4: The fixednesses of tradition can sometimes hinder progress.
meanings.sent5: The fixednesses of the mountain range were awe-inspiring.

meanings.definition: The quality of being firmly established or unchanging.
meanings.sent1: The fixednesses of the ancient ruins fascinated archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: The fixednesses of the rules ensured order in the community.
meanings.sent3: The fixednesses of the clock's hands seemed to mock the concept of time.
meanings.sent4: The fixednesses of the old building reflected its rich history.
meanings.sent5: The fixednesses of the star constellations guided sailors at night.
